cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the problem of detecting fake news using machine learning-based classification systems. The approach presented in the paper involves the use of deep neural networks for efficient text representation, document classification, and natural language inference. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the study of computational models for various aspects of natural language processing. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques such as neural networks and similarity features, which are commonly used in sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper deals with the problem of information retrieval and analysis, which is a common theme in sub-categories such as cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CY (Computers and Society). 

Therefore, the five most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, and cs.CY, ordered from most to least likely.
